name: Zohar Levi
content: Zohar Levi | Te Kura Mātai Pūkaha, Pūrorohiko / School of Engineering and Computer Science | Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington Zohar Levi Please Note This person can no longer be contacted through the School of Engineering and Computer Science at Victoria University of Wellington Qualifications Homepage Biography Zohar Levi is a lecturer in the School of Engineering and Computer Science. He took up his position in 2015. Zohar received his MSc in computer science from Tel-Aviv University (2007) and his PhD in computer science from the Technion (2013) in Israel. Afterwards, he was a post-doctoral researcher in New York University. His main research interest is geometry processing. Problems in the field include: low distortion mappings with applications of shape deformation and surface parametrization; shape interpolation; shape registration; and surface reconstruction. Algorithms and tools developed to address these problems are useful for shape modeling and animation. Print version | Backlinks |
